courses.title: Introduction to GraphQL
courses.description: GraphQL empowers more flexibility into your APIs. Learn to build GraphQL APIs with Apollo Server and create GraphQL Schemas using scalar types, object type, queries and mutations.

lessons.title: Introduction
lessons.description: Scott introduces the course repo, and recommends tools that will be utilized in the course. - https://github.com/FrontendMasters/intro-to-graphql

lessons.title: What is GraphQL?
lessons.description: Scott defines the key points to know about GraphQL

lessons.title: GraphQL vs REST
lessons.description: Scott contrasts GraphQL and REST because the two are often confused

lessons.title: Course Code Overviewdiv>
lessons.description: Scott goes over the package.json, environment variables, and a brief overview of what the rest of the course repository contains. The context of the API that will be created is also discussed

lessons.title: GraphQL Basics & Starting the Server
lessons.description: Scott demonstrates how to create simple types in the schema, and starts the server

lessons.title: GraphQL Playground
lessons.description: Scott demonstrates some of the capabilities of the GraphQL playground

lessons.title: GraphQL Exploration Exercise
lessons.description: Students are instructed to set aside 10 minutes to explore the code, and the GraphQL playground

lessons.title: GraphQL Q&A
lessons.description: Questions are asked about the VSCode GraphQL extension, a clarification about the schemas and resolvers, and Apollo server's relation to Express

lessons.title: GraphQL Exploration Review
lessons.description: Scott demonstrates how to create a type that is type String instead of an Object

lessons.title: GraphQL Schemas
lessons.description: Scott contrasts the GraphQL and database schemas

lessons.title: Schema Definition Language
lessons.description: Scott explains why a Schema Definition Language, or SDL, is the best way to create schemas

lessons.title: Scalar & Object Types
lessons.description: Scott describes what scalars are and the object types that exist in GraphQL

lessons.title: Validations: Non Nullable & List
lessons.description: Scott demonstrates how to require that a field be populated by GraphQL

lessons.title: GraphQL Cheat Sheet
lessons.description: Scott references a resource to utilize when constructing a GraphQL Schema

lessons.title: Query & Mutation Types
lessons.description: Scott explains why queries and mutations are instrumental in a functional API

lessons.title: Writing a Mutation Type
lessons.description: Scott demonstrates how to write a mutation with an input type

lessons.title: Create a Schema Exercise
lessons.description: Students are instructed to create a schema that passes several tests that check for fields, queries, and mutations

lessons.title: Create a Schema Solution
lessons.description: Scott live codes the solution to the exercise

lessons.title: GraphQL Schemas Q&A
lessons.description: Questions are asked regarding where the GQL file gets used, if content is required to be returned, what the schema would look like in a real world application

lessons.title: Resolvers
lessons.description: Scott introduces what Resolvers are, and why they matter

lessons.title: Resolver Arguments
lessons.description: Scott demonstrates how to start writing a resolver that takes a starting object, any arguments from the incoming request, context, and AST of the incoming request

lessons.title: Errors in Resolvers
lessons.description: Scott explains how errors are handled in GraphQL

lessons.title: Implimenting a Resolver
lessons.description: Scott live codes several resolvers to demonstrate how the data is called

lessons.title: Field Type Resolvers
lessons.description: Scott live codes field types underneath the resolvers

lessons.title: Nested Resolvers
lessons.description: Scott demonstrates how resolvers can reference other resolvers and return a value

lessons.title: Relational Data
lessons.description: Scott demonstrates why GraphQL needs to be strongly typed by walking through an example involving relational data

lessons.title: Query Errors
lessons.description: Scott demonstrates what an error looks like as a response from the API

lessons.title: Info Resolver Argument
lessons.description: Scott shows the audience what the info argument looks like to give context to what is meant by an AST

lessons.title: Resolvers Exercise
lessons.description: Students are instructed to create resolvers for the Queries and Mutations on the product type

lessons.title: Resolvers Solution
lessons.description: Scott live codes the solution to the exercise

lessons.title: Resolvers Q&A
lessons.description: Scott answers questions from the audience about clarifications on the last exercise, including how Apollo is processing the schema, extending the current example, and usage of the spread operator in this case

lessons.title: Interfaces
lessons.description: Scott explains how to utilize interfaces as a base type when types are very similar

lessons.title: Unions
lessons.description: Scott explains how to utilize unions, which allow the user to return more than just one type

lessons.title: Interfaces Exercise
lessons.description: Students are instructed to create an interface from the product type, then create types for each possible type

lessons.title: Interfaces Solution
lessons.description: Scott live codes the solution to the exercise

lessons.title: Authentication
lessons.description: Scott introduces several ways that authentication could take place

lessons.title: Authentication Exercise
lessons.description: Students are instructed to authenticate a request, and block requests when appropriate

lessons.title: Authentication Solution
lessons.description: Scott live codes the solution to the exercise

lessons.title: Testing with Jest
lessons.description: Scott gives an overview on how the tests were written for the course

lessons.title: Caching & Performance
lessons.description: Scott gives references to resources, and strategies to handle caching, and improve performance

lessons.title: Dates & Custom Scalars
lessons.description: Scott gives a reference to explore more on dates and custom scalars

lessons.title: Layering GraphQL on REST
lessons.description: Scott gives thoughts on layering GraphQL on to of REST

lessons.title: Sending Multiple Queries
lessons.description: Scott demonstrates how to use an alias to perform two requests on a GraphQL server at the same time

lessons.title: More GraphQL Tools & Services
lessons.description: Scott gives examples of several products that will spin up a GraphQL API for you, tools to make GraphQL easy to work with anywhere, and other resources

users.bio: Scott is the CEO and co-founder of Tipe and Onespeed. Priorly he was an experienced engineer in Silicon Valley and SF working with some of the top tech companies. He's known in the JS community for his contributions to Angular including popular open source projects, conference talks, and courses.

Brian is currently working as a senior program manager on Azure at Microsoft and he's all about developers, developers, developers. Previously he was a JavaScript engineer at Netflix, LinkedIn and Reddit. When not working, Brian finds time to teach on Frontend Masters, run his mouth on Front End Happy Hour, travel all over the world, and play with his adorable dog. Brian is currently a resident of Seattle, WA.

Will Sentance is co-founder and CEO at Codesmith â€“ a software engineering and machine learning residency based in Los Angeles, New York, and Oxford. He is the creator of Icecomm, the most famous developer platform for P2P video and data communication. Before Codesmith, Will was CEO at Ownly and a Software Engineer at Gem. Will graduated from Oxford University and Harvard University.

Sarah is a Senior Developer Advocate at Microsoft, a Vue core team member, and Staff Writer at CSS-Tricks. Sarah is also the co-founder of Web Animation Workshops, with Val Head and co-organizer of Concatenate Conference. She's the author of SVG Animations from O'Reilly and has given Frontend Masters workshops on Vue.js and Advanced SVG Animations. Sarah is formerly Manager of UX Design & Engineering at Trulia (Zillow).
